2025 TX H 5496
Author: Bhojani
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 03/14/2025

By: Bhojani

H.B. No. 5496

A BILL TO BE ENTITLED

AN ACT

relating to the disclosure and use of artificial intelligence.

BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF TEXAS:

SECTION 1. Title 12, Business & Commerce Code, is amended by adding Chapter 611 to read as follows:

CHAPTER 611. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TRANSPARENCY

Sec. 611.001. DEFINITION. In this chapter, "artificial intelligence" means a machine-based system that:

(1) when given a set of objectives by an individual, makes predictions, recommendations, or decisions that influence a real or virtual environment; and

(2) uses inputs from an individual or machine to:

(A) perceive or interpret a real or virtual environment;

(B) use automation to analyze a perception or interpretation of a real or virtual environment; or

(C) use models to infer or form opinions on information or a proposed action.

Sec. 611.002. PROVISION OF INFORMATION BY AND DUTIES OF USER OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE. (a) A person who uses artificial intelligence in conducting business or otherwise providing a good or service, including operating or providing access to a social media platform, creating or distributing political advertising, or providing financial services, to a resident of this state shall:

(1) implement and maintain standards representing the best practices of the artificial intelligence industry;

(2) provide a tool for an individual to whom the person is providing a good or service that enables the individual to detect the use of artificial intelligence;

(3) make available to any individual affected by a decision made by artificial intelligence an explanation of how and why the artificial intelligence reached that decision; and

(4) ensure that artificial intelligence does not demonstrate bias or discriminate against an individual on the basis of any legally protected classification.

(b) Artificial intelligence is considered to be used to provide a good or service to an individual under Subsection (a) regardless of whether the individual can directly access the artificial intelligence.

Sec. 611.003. ENFORCEMENT. A violation of this chapter is a deceptive trade practice under Subchapter E, Chapter 17, and is actionable under that subchapter.

SECTION 2. This Act takes effect September 1, 2025.
